(CRITICIZE)

chastise verb [T]
(PUNISH)
to punish someone, especially by hitting them: Some family campaigners believe in the right to physically chastise children. Fearful that he will be chastised by gangs, the boy has agreed to speak providing his identity is hidden.
More examplesFewer examplesThe overseers were big, brutal men who were not slow to chastise their workers and beat them if they fell behind with quotas.The Spanish army of the eastern Pyrenees had been severely chastised by the soldiers of the republic.They make excuses for continuing to sin and refuse to be chastised and corrected.
